intro: Elatostema wightii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved elatostema, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the family Melastomataceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, particularly found in India and Sri Lanka. The plant features opposite, narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, clustered flowers are typically white or pale pink, with showy petals that attract pollinators. Elatostema wightii thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
